body:
On Mon, Mar 16, 2015 at 5:57 PM, Burcu Dogan <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> They suggested me to the switch to a sync API and let most of the
> optimization to be done by the users in their frame loop.
>
> A typical game looks like:
>
> main() {
>   for {
>      // retrieve state
>      // draw stuff
>      // update other stuff
>      // flush
>   }
> }
>
> Giving them sync APIs allows them to sync the update rate of the
> accelerometer data with their frame rate, e.g. they can ask for new data at
> every n number of frames.
>
I think they've made an assumption that a sync API will return the result
instantaneously?
